DOC.brief_summary: The Supporting Healthy Marriage ( SHM ) evaluation launch 2003 test effectiveness skills-based relationship education program design help low- modest-income married couple strengthen relationship support stable nurturing home environment positive outcome parent child . The evaluation lead MDRC Abt Associates partner , sponsor Administration Children Families , U.S. Department Health Human Services . SHM voluntary , year long , marriage education program lower-income , married couple child expect child . The program provide group workshop base structured curriculum ; supplemental activity build workshop theme ; family support service address participation barrier , connect family service , reinforce curricular theme . The study 's random assignment design compare outcomes family offer SHM 's service outcomes similar group family could access service community .
DOC.criteria: To eligible study , couple suppose low income , marry , least 18 year old , either expect child parent child age 18 living home though couple require provide documentation verify meet eligibility criterion . They also understand one languages SHM service offer ( English , location , Spanish ) . Indication domestic violence relationship
